gallery.name: Temple I (Temple of the Great Jaguar)
gallery.description: A massive pyramid that once served as a tomb for a ruler.

gallery.description: Known for its impressive mask-like carvings and view of the plaza.

gallery.name: Temple IV
gallery.description: The tallest structure in Tikal, offering stunning views over the jungle.

gallery.name: The Great Plaza
gallery.description: The central public space surrounded by grand structures.

gallery.name: Temple III
gallery.description: A pyramid with a rich history, featuring a tomb and notable carvings.

gallery.name: Acropolis of the Lost World
gallery.description: A ceremonial and political center with impressive stonework.

gallery.name: Temple V
gallery.description: A lesser-known but significant pyramid with steep steps.

gallery.name: Howler Monkey

gallery.name: Jaguars
gallery.description: Solitary and elusive big cats that roam the jungle's undergrowth.

gallery.name: Spider Monkey
gallery.description: A long-limbed primate that swings from tree to tree in the canopy.

gallery.name: Toucan
gallery.description: A colorful bird with a large, distinctive bill, often seen in Tikal’s trees.

gallery.name: Coati
gallery.description: A small mammal with a long tail and a curious nature.

gallery.name: Harpy Eagle

gallery.description: A towering tree often regarded as sacred by the Maya.

gallery.name: Mahogany Tree

gallery.name: Wild Orchid
gallery.description: A beautiful flowering plant with various species blooming in the park.

gallery.name: Plumeria
gallery.description: A fragrant, flowering shrub often found in Tikal’s temple grounds.

gallery.name: Palms
gallery.description: A variety of palm trees that grow in the tropical climate of Tikal.
